text: Little Hare () is a 1964 Soviet comedy film directed by Leonid Bykov.Леонид Быков — советский режиссёр, сценарист, актёрКак Высоцкий опекал Абдулова, а Смирнов не смог пережить смерть Быкова == Plot == The film tells about an honest and good man who works as a make-up artist in the theater, who suddenly gets to know he has a month left to live. He decides to spend the last month of his life with dignity and like a good man. The hero starts doing things he was afraid to do his entire life: putting rude people back into their place, protecting people from injustice and self-righteous or abusive people, defending all he can with no second thoughts or regrets. He has no fear now, he is not afraid to be left alone or be laughed at. In the end, as it turns out, the deadly prognosis (which he actually came to know because he was eavesdropping) , was about an actual hare (a play of words: His surname is Zaychik. Zaychik is also a word for "little hare", hence the name of movie).
